title: Michigan AG seeks to pump the brakes on review of DTE data center deal
description: Attorney General Dana Nessel says DTE's request to approve a megadeal to serve an artificial intelligence data center shouldn't go ahead without a public hearing and outside scrutiny.
content:
LANSING, MI - Michigan Attorney General Dana Nessel is opposing utility DTE Energy’s request to rush consideration of a deal to serve a massive data center for ChatGPT creator Open AI and other tech partners.
DTE asked state regulators Friday, Oct. 3... [4406 chars]

title: VEON’s Beeline Kazakhstan Partners with Starlink Direct to Cell to Launch Satellite Connectivity to Kazakhstan, with Support from Kazakhstan Ministry of Artificial Intelligence and Digital Development
description: VEON’s Beeline Kazakhstan Partners with Starlink Direct to Cell to Launch Satellite Connectivity to Kazakhstan, with Support from Kazakhstan Ministry of Artificial Intelligence and Digital Development
content: Almaty and Washington, DC, November 6, 2025 - VEON Ltd. (Nasdaq: VEON), a global digital operator ("VEON”), announces that Beeline Kazakhstan, its digital operator in Kazakhstan, is partnering with Starlink Direct to Cell to make essential connectivi... [5951 chars]

title: OpenAI does not 'want government guarantees' for massive AI data center buildout, CEO Altman says
description: ChatGPT parent OpenAI does not "want government guarantees" for its data centers, CEO Sam Altman said on Thursday, while adding that the startup at the heart of the artificial intelligence boom expects to end this year with an annualized revenue run rate above $20 billion.
content: Nov 6 (Reuters) - ChatGPT parent OpenAI does not "want government guarantees" for its data centers, CEO Sam Altman said on Thursday, while adding that the startup at the heart of the artificial intelligence boom expects to end this year with an annua... [1356 chars]

title: In traffic? Google Maps has a smarter AI assistant for you
description: Google will add its artificial intelligence-powered assistant Gemini into Google Maps, making it possible for drivers to get answers to more complex questions.
content:
Drivers navigating traffic on their morning commutes will be able to do much more than just find directions and the nearest gas station on Google Maps.
In the coming weeks, Google will add its artificial intelligence-powered assistant Gemini into Goo... [3459 chars]

title: From PTSD to panic attacks, Australians are finding comfort in artificial intelligence, but experts urge caution
description: Artificial intelligence chatbots like ChatGPT are embedded in modern life, with some Australians using them to help work through PTSD and toxic work environments.
content:
At 4:30am one day, Julian Walker was vomiting so much from stress that he could not go back to bed.
Desperate for "immediate support", he turned to artificial intelligence (AI).
In fact, for the past three years, AI has been his go-to source of conso... [6687 chars]

title: OpenAI provides lawmakers with suggestions for AI safety standards for minors
description: Microsoft-backed OpenAI has drafted a blueprint for lawmakers to use when crafting any potential legislation regarding minors using artificial intelligence tools, such as chatbots.

title: Nvidia CEO warns 'China is going to win the AI race': report
description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang warns China will overtake America in artificial intelligence due to Western cynicism, excessive regulations and China's lower energy costs.
content:
Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang is warning that China will overtake America in the global artificial intelligence (AI) race.
The chipmaker's chief executive said the West is limiting its own progress in AI through excessive "cynicism," while pointing to Chin... [1867 chars]

title: Republican US lawmakers applaud Trump for holding back Nvidia chips from China
description: A group of eight Republican U.S. senators in a letter on Thursday applauded President Donald Trump's decision to continue denying China access to Nvidia's most advanced artificial intelligence chips.
content:
The letter comes a day after Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang told the Financial Times that China was likely to beat the U.S. in the global AI race, later adding on X that "America wins by racing ahead and winning developers worldwide."
